conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, and C change in position and size when the light source moves to the right above the objects.

The initial scene shows a birdcage, crumpled paper, and wooden spoon above slabs, illuminated by a light source positioned on the left, casting shadows A, B, and C on the ground to the right of the objects.
Shadow A (birdcage) is positioned to the right and slightly below the birdcage.
Shadow B (crumpled paper) is positioned to the right and slightly below the crumpled paper.
Shadow C (wooden spoon) is positioned to the right and slightly below the wooden spoon.

premise: The light source is positioned on the left, casting shadows to the right of the objects.
conclusion: The shadows indicate the light source is to the left of the objects.

premise: When the light source moves to the right, the direction of the shadows changes.
conclusion: The shadows will now be cast to the left of the objects.

conclusion: Shadow A (birdcage) will shift to the left side of the birdcage.

conclusion: Shadow C (wooden spoon) will shift to the left side of the wooden spoon.

conclusion: As the light source moves to the right, the angle changes, affecting the size of the shadows.
